comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Well, OP, since you are new here, I believe you have not come across the [interviews] with Bitcointalk members. That's a thread where a whole lot of members on this forum have shared their stories about how and when they bought their first bitcoin. Many times, this same topic has been discussed, and it doesn't really provide a great help to the Bitcoin space. From the threads I shared, the last one is still active, as is the interview with BitcoiTalk members. In my opinion, I would suggest you lock this thread and learn from the other threads if there is really anything good you intend to learn from your topic.How did you first hear about bitcoin?When did you bought bitcoin?My first Bitcoin

comments.author: arhipova
comments.body: I first learned about bitcoin from another IM forum. Some members on that forum were accepting payments in crypto but I did not take it seriously at that time. But later, when the price of bitcoin started increasing fast, I also started accepting crypto for receiving payments. I am glad that I took that decision because it benefitted me a lot financially. Thereafter, I also invested in alt coins and made good money with it. Now , for all the advancements  related to crypto , I follow bitcointalk.

comments.body: Mate! Apart from this topic being treated so many times in different methods, you are making a mistake that when taken serious can cause you a very big regret in here in the forum. comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: I have been asked of this same question before right in this forum and other crypto-related discussions as well. I am sure many of here can be feeling of nostalgia as we remember the many details leading us to get involved with Bitcoin in particular and cryptocurrency in general. I got into Bitcoin back in 2013 when I bought my first 2 BTC at just $500 each...at that time it was already considered very expensive. I eventually lost of my BTC due to revenue-sharing Ponzi schemes which became also popular at that time. In my country, Bitcoin is getting some ground as there are now a good number of people who are into cryptocurrency as we are always one of the first to adopt anything online.

comments.author: Blitzboy
comments.body: I find it intriguing how a casual discussion may spark an entrepreneurial journey of self-discovery? We can relate to how you went from knowing nothing about Bitcoin to seeing it as a revolutionary force that could change people's lives. Your journey from Bitcoin to XRP is similar to many fans'. Those virtual money might have a very alluring charm.But lets take a closer look at these layers. Your story touches on more than just financial investments. Its about a mentality evolving, about moving from skepticism to evangelism. I commend your entrepreneurial spirit, but I also think you should temper your excitement with some suspicion. A sustained path requires a keen awareness of the inherent dangers and market dynamics of cryptocurrency.
